They are asking for this loan to expand their marketing and create credit for their business.

loans.use: to expand marketing and create business credit

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 43 years old, married and blessed with six children aged between three years and 21 years old. 

He is a blacksmith, a business he has been doing for the past 19 years. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase metal that he will use to make jikos (stoves), drums and metal boxes.

The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan, and this is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase metal that he will use to make jikos (stoves), drums and metal boxes.

loans.name: Zubaidullo

texts.ru: Зубайдулло женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 3-х лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции. Жена помогает по бизнесу, и они вместе стараются расширить бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль ради содержания своей большой семьи. Зубайдулло хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и горюче- смазочных материалов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Zubaidullo is married and raising five children.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over three years.  His wife helps him with the business, and, together, they try to expand the business and make a good profit in order to support their large family.  Zubaidullo wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 4000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Jessica Monica

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda naturista su historia empezó cuando una familia le comento sobre los productos y se aventuro a venderlos desde ahí los distribuye y su hermana le ayuda a vender la ropa.

Su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, si tiene2 hijas, su sueño más importante es ponerse un local. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda naturista y tambien para generar mas ingresos en la venta de ropa para hombre y mujer.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 29 year old woman, and she has great aspirations for her natural product business to prosper in the coming years.  Her story started when a family commented about the products, and she started selling them.  From there she distributes them.  

Her sister helps her sell the clothes.

She does her work alone every day.  She has problems with the delinquency.  She is not married, but she has two daughters.

Her most important dream is to establish a local.  That is why she wants the loan for her natural product business.  She wants to generate more income selling clothing for men and women.

loans.use: to buy natural products and clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 26 years old and married with two children. She runs a greengrocery to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Christine has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old and married with two children. He sells men's and women's jeans to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's and women's jeans to sell.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's jeans to sell

loans.name: Kalunda

texts.en: Kalunda is 43 years old and married with three children. She runs a greengrocery to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta is 31 years old and single.  She lives in Bamburi, Mombasa where she sells jewelry, which she has been doing for three years with success. 

Benedeta is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more earrings, bangles, finger rings, and hair clips to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings, bangles, finger rings, and hair clips.

loans.name: Tatiana Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a Tatiana, tiene 29 años, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres.

Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la ciudad y con los pocos recursos que tenia y aprovechando sus conocimientos instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También en su local vende productos y tratamientos de belleza y cosméticos.  Lleva más de 8 años con su salón y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en la compra de tintes, permanentes y ciertas herramientas que aun necesita. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un SPA
texts.en:
In the locality of La Mocota, Colon parish, Portoviejo city, a place known for its hard-working people dedicated to agriculture and cattle-raising, the members of the La Mocota Communal Bank gather each 15 days.

Here we meet Tatiana, 29 years old and single, who lives in her parents' house. Some years ago, Tatiana was trained as a beautician and personal care specialist in an academy in the city. And with the little resources she had, Tatiana took advantage of her knowledge, installing a beauty salon in her home. She performs diverse services there: tinting, hair cuts, and nail painting, among other things. She works from Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm, and at times, even later if her customers require her services. Also, Tatiana sells products, beauty treatments, and cosmetics in her shop. She has had the salon for more than 8 years and it's doing very wel, with many clients. 

The loan will be used to buy dyes, permanents, and certain equipment which she still lacks. Tatiana was a member of her communal bank from its beginning, and she enjoys the bank for the help and benefits she receives from it. Her dream is to open a spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, and certain equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lonkishu Ole

texts.en:
Lonkishu is taking out his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD that will facilitate his land preparation and purchase of farm inputs to help get better yields.


He intends to use anticipated profits to support the business and provide for basic family needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To prepare his wheat farm for the next season of planting and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Upendo Mlonganzila Group

texts.en:
Festo, who is in his early 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school.  He has been running a food shop for 10 years now.  He works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase stock of missing items in the shop and to pay household expenses.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. He wants a new loan to buy a second-hand deep freezer.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Upendo Mloganzila," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Originally from Venezuela, Carlos moved to the United States seven years ago, but kept his ties to Latin and South America very tight. In 2006, Carlos founded his own distribution enterprise that focused mainly on electrical equipment, generators, and solar panels. Using his connections to Latin and South America, he was able to set up both a domestic and international distribution network. All of Carlos’s generators are bio-fueled machines and work solely on vegetable oil or in accordance with it. Along with distributing in Florida, where he now resides, he set up his strongest ties throughout the United States, Mexico, Venezuela, Puerto Rico, and Ecuador. Most of the sales come in the form of large wholesales; however, he is also open to the public market as well. Along with the actual equipment, Carlos also offers support and warranties for his sales. The business is set up so that the buyer pays a down payment on the equipment before actual sale; however, this never covers the entirety of the purchase. The sale is paid in full only after delivery. Due to this, Carlos is left putting up much of the initial cost. This loan would be used by Carlos to alleviate this burden and to increase his inventory to create a better functioning business.

loans.use: To cover initial distribution fees

loans.name: Fabiola  Azucena

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fabiola, tiene 34 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, una niña de 11 años que estudia en la escuela y un niño de 4 años. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 ya que tiene que esperar que llegue su hija de la escuela, luego en la tarde a veces también sale a vender, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo o Guayaquil. Tiene más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de temporada playera como: bermudas, trajes de baño, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños que es lo que más se vende en la actualidad. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta por la puntualidad con que se realiza todo en la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
In the town of Mocora of the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo, known for its hardworking people dedicated to agriculture and animal farming, the members of the Community Bank La Mocora gather together every 15 days.

In this place, we met Fabiola, 34, married with 2 children, an 11-year-old daughter who is in school and a 4-year-old son. Her husband is a professional chauffeur. She is a very good housewife who is also an entrepreneur. She sells all kinds of clothing, door to door, or from her house where her clients come when she has new merchandise. 

She works every day from 8am to 11am, when she goes back home to wait for her daughter to arrive from school. Sometimes in the afternoons, she also goes out to sell. She sells on credit and collects every week. She buys her merchandise in the cities of Puertoviejo or Guayaquil. She’s been in this line of work for more than 6 years and it’s been going well.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing for the beach season, like Bermuda shorts, bathing suits, t-shirts, blouses and children’s clothing, which she currently sells the most. She is a founding member of the Community Bank and its president. She appreciates the punctuality with which the institution gets things done.
Her dreams are to continue getting ahead with her business and personal life.

loans.use: buy Bermuda shorts, bathing suits, t-shirts, blouses and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством, а Аличон зарабатывает  на содержание семьи. На  накопленные деньги  купил себе машину. Вот уже более 2-х лет  занимается перевозкой пассажиров предоставляя услуги такси. Аличон хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для установки газового оборудования на автомашине.
texts.en: Alijon is a hardworking and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has two children.  His wife is involved in household work, and Alijon earns a living to support his family.  He bought a car with his savings and has been involved in transporting passengers by providing a taxi service for over two years now.  Alijon wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni to install a gas equipment for his car.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 8 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Имеет двухэтажный коровник, на первом этаже откармливает скот, а на втором этаже хранит корм. Олимчон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью увлечения их поголовья и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Olimjon is married and raising three children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Olimjon has been involved in buying and selling cattle for over eight years.  He has a two-story cowshed, fattens up livestock on the first floor and stores livestock feed on the second floor.  Olimjon is requesting this loan to buy livestock in order to increase its headcount and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sohibnazar

texts.ru: Сохибназар житель района Шахритус. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его дети находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сам он у себя дома занимается животноводством. Он в основном закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков и корма для скота.
texts.en: Sohibnazar is a resident of the Shahrituz district.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  His children are working in the Russian Federation.  Sohibnazar is involved in animal husbandry at home.  He primarily buys cattle for future resale.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls and livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy bulls and livestock feed

loans.name: Comadres Vip Group

texts.es:
Comadres VIP es un grupo formado por 7 mujeres emprendedoras que decidieron llamarse así porque entre ellas las une una gran amistad.
Dentro de las integrantes de este grupo se encuentra Liliana de 31 años, a la que cariñosamente llaman Lili, está casada y con tres hijos (10, 3 y un bebé de 7 meses).  Inició su negocio cuando su esposo se quedó sin empleo y se vio en la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia; se ha especializado tanto haciendo manualidades que quiere que su negocio siga creciendo.
Lili sueña con establecer un negocio más grande e impartir talleres de manualidades, para que como ella, otras mujeres de su colonia tengan una opción más para ayudarse.
texts.en:
Comadres VIP is a group made up of 7 entrepreneurial women. They chose the group name because of the great friendship that unites them.

Among the group members is 31 year old Liliana, who is called Lili. She is married and has three children of ages 10, 3, and a baby of 7 months. Lili started her business when her husband lost his job and she saw the need to generate income in order to support her family. She has specialized in making crafts and wants her business to continue to grow. Lili dreams of establishing a bigger business and holding crafts workshops so that other women in her neighborhood can have another option to help themselves just as she does.

loans.use: to stock merchandise to generate more income.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.ru:
Халиде 54 года, имеет 3 детей. 
В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1997 году Халида начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки скота на  сумму 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Халиды, на сегодня  ее хозяйство, насчитывающее 2 коровы и 10 овец, приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Халида  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров. Доходы Халида планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Khalida is 54 years old and has three children.  In search of a financing source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1997 with a purchase of livestock with 50,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Khalida's hard work, her business, containing two cows and ten sheep, yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further expand her business, Khalida requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy two dairy cows.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 37 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children ages 3 and 16, who both are in school and live at home.  Mamie did not go to school.

For the past 20 years, Mamie has been selling charcoal. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling  from her mother. One problem she faces is less commodity. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper, and salt for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plans is to build her house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onion, soap, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Tete

texts.en: Tete is 26 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children, ages 1 and 7. Her husband is a farmer. Tete is requesting a loan to purchase more rubbers dishes(plates, cups, bowls) for her business. She wishes to build her own house and send her children to the best schools.

loans.use: to purchase more rubbers dishes(plates, cups ,bowls) for her business

loans.name: Kumah

texts.en: Kumah  is 25 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and  has three children between the ages of 4 and 6. They  attend school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling cassava, potatoes, and yams. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, potatoes, and yams for her business. She wishes to be an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes, and yams for her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 14 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells local brew (local beer).

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials to be used in the process of making the local brew and will help Francis generate greater profits and pay for his children’s school fees and medical expenses. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house of his own.

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials to be used in the process of making the local brew

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bunghoko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past four years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar for resale. It will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Irene hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in yei. She is a fish seller, and has been in business for three years. She is 39, married, and has no child,  

Fatuma heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Yei she sells food stuffs, and has been in business for four years. She is 36 year old, married, and has four children, three of them are still in school. 

Janet heard about BRAC South Sudan from credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 in order to purchase sugar, oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is twenty-eight years old, married, with two children. She beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and employs one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy hair chemicals, a hair drier and a machine to blow dry hair.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, a hair drier and a machine to blow dry hair.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is single and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Ana Cristinan

texts.es: Ana Cristian tiene 25 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una farmacia la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes que la visitan. Este negocio lo emprende con fondos propios y ha luchado por salir adelante invirtiendo cada día mas en el negocio hasta verlo bien surtido. Ana Cristian está solicitando financiamiento para invertir más en el negocio en la compra de productos como sal adrews, zorritones, vapor rus, vitaminas, variedad de  pastillas, entre otros medicamentos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana Cristian, 25, runs a little pharmacy out of her house where she attends customers. She started this business with her own funds and has fought to get ahead, investing in it each day, until it is well stocked. Ana Cristian is requesting a loan to invest more in her pharmacy, like Andrews salt (brand of medicine for upset stomach), Zorritones (brand of medicine for cold and flu), Vapo Rub, vitamins, a variety of pills and other medications that her customers ask for.

loans.use: Andrews salt (brand of medicine for upset stomach), Zorritones (brand of medicine for cold and flu), Vapo Rub, vitamins, a variety of pills and other medications that her customers ask for.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
Jose tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos en el departamento de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles, Jose es un hombre muy trabajador y entuasiasta, siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, es su mano derecha y la persona que lo motiva siempre al igual que sus hijos para salir adelnate, uno de los pasatiempos favoritos de Jose es el Canto, asimismo su platillo favorito son los riquísimos “Tallarines a lo Alfredo”.

Con mucho esfuerzo el logro tener su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de abarrotes en su bodega, asimismo los fines de semana trabaja cantando en eventos pequeños, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes, también en algunas oportunidades alquila su mototaxi y con ello puede tener un dinero extra para los gastos adicionales del hogar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda un trato amable y cortes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que por segunda oportunidad le han brindado su apoyo y gracias a ello el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (arroz, azúcar, menestras, entre otros), asimismo podrá realizar los trámites para obtener la documentación en regla de su mototaxi, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener más motos para alquilar”.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ica. Ica is the only city along the southern coast formed by plains, also known as coastal plains, due to the Andes mountain range entering the region. In Ica there are vast deserts, such as Pampas de Lancha and Pampas de Villacurí, where it gets very hot. The area also has beaches and thermal baths, a variety of marine life, museums, and excellent hotel service.

Jose is a very hard-working and enthusiastic man. He always counts on the support of his wife. She is his right-hand woman and the one who always motivates him (along with his children) to keep going. One of Jose's favorite pastimes is singing and his favorite meal is delicious pasta alfredo.

With a lot of effort he was able to have his business selling groceries from his store. He also sings on the weekends for small events. He works at his store around 8 hours and can serve up to 30 customers. He will also occasionally rent his moto-taxi and this provides him with extra money for the home's expenses. He believes his business is going well because he provides kind and polite service.

Jose is very thankful with the Kiva lenders for the second opportunity they have provided him through their support. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to buy more merchandise for his business (rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, and more). He will also be able to pay for motorcycle permits to have the proper documentation for his moto-taxi, which will increase his earnings and help him keep working toward his dream "to have more motorcycles to rent".

loans.use: buy merchandise (rice, sugar, mixed vegetables, and others), and a motorcycle permit

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao, a 19-year-old-married woman who lives with her partner and child in Ornlong Veng district, generates her income by walking around the commune and nearby areas with her trailer, selling fast food. Her foods include skewers of grilled beef, boiled eggs, fried meatball, papaya salad and some soft drinks.

Earning an average of $4.00 per day, Kao wants to make her life more comfortable. She is therefore requesting her second loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle to connect to her trailer in order expand her sales area. Kao is very thankful to our lenders for their support in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata Wanjiku is 36 years old. She is a married mother of one child. She has been rearing rabbits and selling them for the past three years. Her business is doing great.
This loan to finance her business is Consolata's second from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more young rabbits for rearing. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and expand her business further. Consolata hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more young rabbits to rear.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 56-year-old married businessman from Kongowea, Mombasa. He sells bananas to his customers, a business he has run with success for the past three years. This is his third loan from Kiva partner KADET to finance his business. With the loan, Peter plans to purchase more bananas to sell. With the proceeds, he will repay his loan and expand his business further. 
Peter hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas.

loans.name: Keva

texts.en:
Keva is a 39-year-old taxi operator in Mombasa. He is married and is a father of two children. His business has been in operation for the past 15 years and it is doing great.
This is Keva's third loan with Kiva partner KADET. He plans to use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his taxi. He will use the anticipated profits to open a business for his spouse and educate his children. Keva hopes to provide a comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella, a 39-year-old mother of one, has been selling used shoes to earn a living for 10 years, and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. Angella is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia, 59, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Tomas, her business partner, and is a mother to six children. Together, Sofia and Tomas work hard to provide a safe and secure future for their family.
Sofia operates a piggery business. Live pigs are raised, slaughtered, and then sold to members of the immediate community. Sofia has many customers who also buy live pigs to be sold in the market. Many customers prefer Sofia’s products since they are assured of their quality. It is also a little cheaper to buy live pigs directly from her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Sofia earns a minimum of 550 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Sofia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Sofia hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day, and able to finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.*
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 42-year-old food stall owner in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is married. She has been running her business successfully for the past four years. 
This is Florence's second loan to finance her business from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and repay her loan. 
Florence hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.

loans.name: Patricia Lissette

texts.es: Patricia, es casada, tiene 24 años, tiene dos niñas de edades de 4 y 8 años una de ella asiste a una escuela primaria. Actualmente es dueña de una pulpería ubicada es su casa de habitación inicio su negocio hace 4 años con  ayuda de remesas que  le envía su esposo desde costa rica. Es su primer negocio solicito el crédito para invertir compras de granos básicos, aceite, productos de Limpieza, avenas, sopas , enlatados, útiles escolares .Sus expectativas son crecer en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desarrollarse como emprendedora.
texts.en: Patricia, 24, is married and has 2 daughters, aged 4 and 8. The older daughter goes to school. Patricia owns and runs a grocery store out of her house. She started her business 4 years ago with the financial help she receives from her husband in Costa Rica. This is her first business. She is requesting a loan to invest in basic grains, oil, cleaning products, oats, soup, canned goods and school supplies. Her expectations are to grow her business, improve her family’s quality of life and develop as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy basic grains, oil, cleaning products, oats, soup, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, a 53-year-old married mother of three, has been a landlady in Majaoni, Mombasa for the past five years and is doing very well. Now requesting her fourth business loan from KADET LTD., Elizabeth plans to renovate her rental houses and will use the anticipated profits to build more houses to rent.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Pedro Raul

texts.es: Pedro, de 66 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de 5 hijos. Don Pedro nos cuenta que desde muy joven trabaja en las actividades propias del campo pero desde hace 20 años ejerce  el oficio de constructor esta actividad empezó a desarrollarla después de los 25 años de edad y fue notando que ganaba mejor  en a actividades que mejor conocía como era la siembra de maíz y sorgo que es el producto que hoy en día siembra y comercializa. El requiere el crédito para compra de insumos, pago de mano de obra, compra de semilla de maíz y sorgo. Sus expectativas es obtener una buena cosecha de granos básicos y lograr ampliar las areas de siembra.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 66 year old farmer. He is married and has 5 children. 

From a very young age Pedro worked on his own activities in the field, but for the past 20 years he has worked as a builder, a trade he began to develop when he was 25 years old. He saw that he made more money in activities that he knew better, such as the sowing of corn and sorghum. These are the products that he sows and commercializes today. 

Pedro needs this loan to pay for labor and to purchase inputs and corn and sorghum seeds. His expectation is to obtain a good harvest of basic grains and to enlarge his sowing areas.

loans.use: to purchase inputs, labor, and corn and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, a 56-year-old resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines, is married to Rodante, a farmer, and the mother of four children, all of whom are already married and settled down with their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida operates a farm growing pineapples in Cavite, which is located in the high lands where the conditions for pineapples are optimal. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm, and she expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Zenaida dreams of having a better life when they grow old. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 27 years old, and she runs a boutique in Chaani, Mombasa. She is a married mother of one  child and  she has been operating this business for the past six years. Her business is doing great.

This is her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more skirts, trousers, sweaters and shirts. 

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more stock. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more skirts, trousers, sweaters and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 41 años de edad y es parte del grupo Las Estrellas, desde hace 7 años se dedica a la renta de huertas de aguacate y durazno para después cortar la fruta y venderla en la central de abastos por cubetas. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque tiene tiempo de atender a sus hijos ya que desde muy temprano sale a vender sus frutos y ya en la tarde está desocupada para hacer los quehaceres de su casa. Ella está casada con el señor Jesús el cual también se dedica a la venta de frutas, ellos tiene dos hijos de nombres Eduardo de 9 años estudiante de primaria y Mayra de 18 años la cual estudia la preparatoria. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la así poder rentar otra huerta mas con la cual va a tener un poco mas de ganancias y así poder tener un poco mas de dinero ahorrado por cualquier emergencia que tenga su hija o su familia ya que la enfermedad de su hija Mayra que desde los 11 años padece que es diabetes infantil  tiene que estar muy al pendiente de ella porque abeces le sube el azúcar y tiene que tenerla muy controlada tanto en su alimentación como en sus medicamentos para que no se ponga mal porque el medicamento sale muy caro. La meta que tiene Doña Trinidad es hacer su propia huerta comprar un gran terreno donde pueda cultivar un poco de todos los frutos que se dan en su región. Las otras cinco personas se llaman Clementina, María Angélica, Clara y Estela ellas invertirán sus créditos en abonos orgánicos e insecticidas para sus huertas de aguacate y pollos y borregos.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 41 years old and is a member of the 'Las Estrellas' community bank.  For seven years she has been renting avocado and peach orchards whose fruit she picks and then sells in the local wholesale food market by the bucket.  She says that she really enjoys her work because it leaves her time to care for her children as she goes out very early in the morning to sell her fruit and in the afternoon she is free to do her housework.

Trinidad is married to Jesús who also sells fruit.  The couple have two children: 9-year-old Eduardo who is in elementary school and 18-year-old Mayra who is in high school.  Trinidad says that she is requesting a loan so that she can rent an additional orchard which will make her a little more profit so that she can have a little more money saved up for dealing with any emergencies that her daughter or any other members of her family might experience.  Trinidad's daughter Mayra has suffered from childhood-onset diabetes since she was 11 years old and she has to be alert because sometimes her blood sugar levels rise.  She has to keep control of the situation, both in terms of what she eats and her medication, so that she doesn't fall ill because medicines are very expensive.  Trinidad's goal is to own her own orchard.  She would like to buy a large plot of land where she can grow a little of all the fruits that grow in her region.

The other five members of this group are Clementina, María Angélica, Clara and Estela.  They will invest their loans in buying organic fertilizers and insecticides for their avocado orchards.  They will also buy chickens and lambs.

loans.use: to rent land which has avocados, peaches and guava growing on it

loans.name: Lux Estela

texts.es: La señora Luz es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, desde hace unos 10 años ella se dedica a su negocio de Pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos como ser arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevos, pan, leche, productos de uso personal, útiles escolares entre otros, ella realiza sus compras en el mercado de la comunidad, sus clientes son sus vecinos, su negocio esta abierto de lunes a domingo. Esta solicitando crédito por L. 18,000.00  para invertirlo en compra de  abarrotería y refrescos ya que en esta época sus ventas se mejoran y de esta manera obtiene mas ganancias. El sueño es que su hija siga estudiando y luego trabaje para que pueda contribuir con los gastos del hogar
texts.en:
Sra. Lux is a single mother with two children. For 10 years she has had a grocery store business where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, beans, sugar, eggs, bread, milk, personal use items and school supplies, among others. She makes her purchases in the local market. Her customers are her neighbors and she is open from Monday to Sunday.

Lux is applying for a loan for 18,000 HNL (Honduran Lempira) to invest in the purchase of groceries and soft drinks since her sales improve during this season and she earns more income. 

Her dream is that her daughter will continue studying and then go to work so she will be able to contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
This is Katlyn, 28, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a single mother to her child. She manages her own household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
 
Katlyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Katlyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and dreams of sending her child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 24 years old and she is a cereals shop owner in Kisauni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of one and has been selling cereals for the past four years with great success.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more maize, beans, peas and green grams (lentils). 

She will use the anticipated profits to open other business outlets. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans, peas and green grams (lentils)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 41 years old, and she runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Wiclife

texts.en:
Wiclife is a 30-year-old greengrocer in Barsheba, Mombasa. He is single and has been doing this business for the past four years with success. 

This is his second loan with KADET LTD, to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to expand his business further. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and carrots

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum is a local farmer from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common-law relationship with her husband who works in the same business and she is blessed with five children. They all are married and live independently around the province. Tum is now 60 years old and she has been in rice husbandry for over 30 years with a good experience she has learned from it.

Tum has applying for a loan to dig a well in her yard for household use because previously, her family has met with difficulties, especially in the dry season due the lack of enough water or they have to go far from the village to get it. Tum is very happy and grateful for a constant help from our lenders. Now, it’s her third loan with HKL.

loans.use: to dig a well in her yard for household use.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  is 43 years old, married, and a mother of two school-going children. She is a tailor in Mombasa, a business she has been doing for the past three years. She is doing great. 

This is her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase sewing thread and materials for making clothes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing thread and materials for making clothing

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 37 years old and is married with two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. She does maize farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cooking oil, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, maize flour and sugar to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 52-year-old man from Migori County, married to Auma, and they have seven children aged between five and 23 years.

Wilson operates a cattle selling business, a business he has been doing for the last 10 years making a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is taking his fourth loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy cattle, goats and sheep for sale. He will use his profits to repay the loan. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy cattle, goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her husband works as a construction decorator in summer time. The three kids are all college students. She started garment retailing business in 2002. Since that time, she has been selling the goods in the local store. The shop counter is in good position and she has already made a number of regular customers there. 

Altantsetseg is a bright woman who says, "I would like to expand the business by getting the supplies in large quantities so that I could save the transportation expenses and save for my kids' college tuition fees." The total amount she is requesting is 600,000 MNT to buy garments.

loans.use: To purchase garments for resale

loans.name: Caroly Marinel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Caroly, ella  tiene 45 años está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 11 y  9 años de edad,  los dos mayores  estudian en  colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es maestro albañil. 

Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las 15h00 y los sabados y domingos hasta las 19h00 ya que en estos días también prepara y vende meriendas. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos cuando ellos pueden aunque la mayor parte del tiempo trabaja sola. Lleva más de 19 años con su negocio y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos además porque para cada dia varia su menú.
 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque las socias son muy cumplidas. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Caroly, 45. She is married and she has three children aged 16, 11 and 9. The first two go to high school, the youngest to primary school. Her husband is a master builder.

She runs a small restaurant in her house, preparing delicious dishes. She works Mondays to Fridays from 6 am to 3 pm, and Saturdays and Sundays until 7 pm, as during the weekends she also prepares and sells “meriendas” (midday meals). Her husband and her children help her whenever they can, even thought she mostly works alone. She has been running her restaurant for more than 19 years and things have always gone very well: her customers choose her for the good taste of her dishes and because she daily changes her menu.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other provisions to prepare her dishes. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years and she likes it because of the extreme correctness of her fellow member.

Her goals are to carry on with her activity and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat,and fish.

loans.name: Fidencia Del Pilar

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fidencia, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun vive con ella junto a su esposa y un pequeño hijo. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella  es una gran ama de casa que tiene un negocio de venta de queso y leche de soya en su casa, lugar al que acuden sus clientes dia a dia ya que son deliciosos los productos que vende, tres veces por semana recibe queso al por mayor que le envían desde Chone para luego venderlo por libras  en su pequeño local, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 17h00 , trabaja sola y  viene realizando esta actividad por 16 años y  le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar quesos y leche de soya. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la ayuda que le dan para seguir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.

En la foto esta la socia con su nieto.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Fidencia, 52. She is married and she has three adult children; of them still lives in her house with his wife and his young child. Her husband is a trader.

She is a very good housewife who runs a cheese and soy milk selling activity in her house: her customers come to her house every day because of the delicious products she sells. Three times a week wholesalers send her cheese form Chone, and she sells it POR LIBRAS in her small store. She works every day form 7 am to 5 pm; she works alone, she has been running this activity for 16 years and things have been going very well.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cheese and soy milk. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for more than 4 years, and she likes it because it is easy to obtain loans and because the loans help her getting ahead.

Her dream is to own a car.

The child in the picture with her is her grandson.

loans.use: To buy cheese and soy milk.

loans.name: J Endelea

texts.en: J Endelea is 41 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. He does livestock farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Chuma

texts.en:
Chuma is a 52-year-old man from Migori County, Western Kenya. He is married to Mary and they have five children aged between eight and 22 years old.

Chuma sells firewood in Migori and has been doing this for the last four years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy firewood logs for sale and some of it to buy charcoal. 

His anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy firewood logs for sale.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is from the village of Zinakidzeebi. She is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband Abessalom and three children (23, 21 and 19 years old). Lili earns income through selling dairy products. She purchases various dairy products from local farmers and sells them at the local open market. Abessalom is responsible for the agricultural business of the family. They have 0.3 hectares of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown. Harvested products are also sold by Lili at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Lili requested credit to increase her stock in trade. She will purchase more dairy products to resell on the market. Lili will increase her turnover and the income of the family will grow. Lili plans to use additional income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products for resale

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
This is Domingo, 43, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Helen, a housewife and mother to their children. By the grace of God, Domingo has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Domingo operates their tricycle business. They have two tricycles that carry up to four passengers to their destination within the community, both of which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 700 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his tricycle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Domingo dreams of being able to buy another tricycle soon. He also hopes for his children to finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle (motorcycle transport vehicle).

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, age 54, is a modest lady who sells charcoal to earn a living. She and her husband Charles live in the town of Migori, situated in the Western part of Kenya. They have six children between the ages of five and 25 years old.

Judith has operated her business for the last six years, making a monthly income of KES. 24,000. She is taking out her fourth loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy a stock of charcoal to offer for sale. 

Her profits will be used to support her family and to repay the loan. Her dream is to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli, 53 years old, lives in the village of Urekhi with her husband, 30-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Nanuli is very busy at the local open market, selling vegetables that she purchases from local farmers. She also sells produce grown on the 0.3 hectare plot of land the family owns. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Nanuli is now requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables for resale. As the turnover increases, Nanuli’s profit from trade will increase, and she will use the increased income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 43, sells second-hand clothing and shoes to earn her living. She and her husband Paul live in Migori town. They have six children aged between five and 18 years old.

Alice has operated her business for the last eight years, making a monthly income of KES. 10,000. She is taking her sixth loan from KADET Ltd., which she will use to buy additional stock of second-hand clothing and shoes to offer for sale.

She will use profits to support her family and to repay the loan. Her dream is to open a butcher shop and ensure the education of her kids.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of second-hand clothing and shoes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 41 years old and married with three children. He sells natural medicines to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people. He does maize farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a fridge to store natural medicines for sale.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to store natural medicines for sale

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 53 years old. He lives in the village of Akhalsheni, West Georgia with his family: his 35-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and three grandchildren (15, 14 and 10 years old). The children go to school. 

Nugzar is a taxi driver. He provides transportation services to the population of his district. Along with his main job, Nugzar is actively involved in family agriculture, which is led by his son and serves as an important source of income. The family owns 0.5 hectares of land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. Nugzar sells harvested fruits and vegetables to retailers on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Nugzar requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. He has a cattle-shed where the cow will be placed. Nugzar will produce cheese and sell it on the local open market as well. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase needed household goods, to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
This is Melissa, 33, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Venjune, an auto mechanic, and mother to their children. By the grace of God Melissa has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Melissa has overseen operations of their auto shop business for almost 15 years. They offer car services like changing oil and they sell auto parts.  Melissa’s husband is the one who does the services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for materials needed for autos, such as welding rods, wheel brushes/wire brushes, filters, brake fluid, and much more. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Melissa dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, other items and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Inés María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos que es soltero  aun vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja por razones de salud.

Ella para sacar adelante a su familia ahora que su marido no puede trabajar se dedica a la venta de bocadillos y bebidas ya que tiene a su cargo el bar de una escuela en Rocafuerte, vende jugos naturales, frutas y bocadillos pero preparados sanamente, tambien prepara comida para los maestros y ciertos alumnos que almuerzan en el plantel, en la actualidad está vendiendo almuerzos pero solo bajo pedido, esto lo hace ya que en estos días no hay clases y la escuela está cerrada por eso ella busca la forma para ganar algo gasta que empiecen las clases y todo vuelva a la normalidad. Lleva 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la misma que empezó con su primer crédito.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para elaborar los alimentos y frutas. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un restaurante  en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Inés, 54. She is married and she has three adult children; one of them is single and still lives with her. Her husband is unemployed for health reasons.

To provide for her family now that her husband is unable to work, she engages in selling sandwiches and drinks, running a bar in a school in Rocafuerte. She sells natural juices, fruits and the healthy sandwiches she prepares; she also prepares meals for the teachers and for some students that have lunch in the school. She is currently selling many lunches, and she works to order. She is doing this now that school is closed and there are no lessons, and she therefore needs to earn some money until school starts again and everything gets back to normal. She has been engaged in this activity for 5 years, and she has started it thanks to her first loan.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits and provisions to prepare her meals. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 5 years and she likes it because thanks to her first loan she has been able to start her activity.

Her dream is to run a restaurant in the city center.

loans.use: To buy fruits and provisions to prepare her sandwiches.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con su hijo el cual es independiente económicamente, viven en la casa de sus padres de Marisol, quienes son jubilados y reciben una pensión mensual por parte del estado, la casa en la que viven esta ubicada en el “AAHH Santa Cruz” ubicado en el Distrito de Tambogrande en la Provincia de Piura.

Marisol cuenta con una pequeña bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, entre otros, para esto ha recibido el apoyo de sus padres quienes le han dado un espacio donde ella pueda instalar dicho negocio, ya son 5 años a los que ella se viene dedicando a esta actividad, adicionalmente también recibe el apoyo de su único hijo quien la apoya económicamente.

Marisol desea comprar cerveza para que venda los fines de semana (viernes, sábados, domingos), ya que normalmente sus vecinos le solicitan pero por falta de capital no la podido invertir, y es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 3000 Nuevos Soles.
Es conocida para nuestra institución pues ya ha tenido créditos anteriores pagando de manera puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marisol is 47 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her son who is financially independent.  They live in her parents' home.  Her parents are retired and receive a monthly pension from the State.  Their home is located in the Santa Cruz squatter settlement, in Tambogrande district, in Piura province.  

Marisol has a small grocery store where she sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, meat, etc.  She has received support from her parents who gave her a space in which to set up her business.  She has been working in this business for five years.  She also receives help from her only son who supports her financially.

Marisol would like to buy beer to sell at weekends (Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays).  Her neighbors ask her for this product but, owing to a lack of capital, she has not been able to make the investment.  This is why she is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Marisol is well known by our institution as she has received previous loans and made her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer as a new product for her business

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 38 years old and married with two children. She runs a greengrocery to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 35,000 Kenya Shillings to buy onions, vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen is 42 years old and she is married with four children, living in Ang Snoul district. Phen is in the business of cultivating rice. Her spouse works as a construction worker to share responsibility for the family. The main source of income is generated from her husband; typically he is able to earn around USD 8.00 per day.

Phen would like to take out her first loan from HKL and Kiva to repair her kitchen. She wants to make it become a healthier place for cooking and serving foods for the family. Phen intends to place her children in a good university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 53 años de dad, es casada y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad quines viven em lugares diferentes, ella vive con su esposo y cuenta com casa propia, vive en um caserio de nombre Zaña ubicado en el distrito de Saqa el cual pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y esta a 2 horas aproximadamente.

Gladis se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, actividad la cual há sido el sustento de su familia durante 11 años, su negocio lo tiene instalado en su próprio domicilio, y recorre los diferentes caserios aledaños al suyo con el fin de conseguir mas clientes de los que ya tiene, pues ya ellos la conocen por ser uma mujer trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos comerciales, pues cuenta con todo el apoyo de parte de su esposo, y es que la realcion que existe emtre ellos es muy buena. 

Ahora esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con los cuales aumentará su capital de trabajo comprando más productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 53-year-old married mother with grown children who live in different areas. She lives with her husband in their own home in a hamlet called Zaña, located in the Saqa district of the Chiclayo province, which is approximately 2 hours away from the city.

Gladis sells beauty products by catalog, which has been her family's source of income for 11 years. She set up her business in her home, and she travels to the surrounding towns in order to gain even more customers. Her existing customers know that she is a hardworking woman who is responsible with her business commitments since she has her husband's support, and they have a very good relationship.

She is now requesting a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, and she will use the money to increase her business capital by purchasing more beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 44 años de edad, junto a su esposo tienen 5 hijos y viven en la ciudad de Mala, Mala es un valle de origen aluviónico, formado por la presencia del río del mismo nombre, tiene  elevaciones de regular altitud constituida por lomas y contrafuertes andinos que en ocasiones llegan hasta el litoral; presenta también como zona geográfica destacada, llamada "Los Platanales", constituida por terrenos antaño muy húmedos y salitrosos, donde afloraba abundante agua del subsuelo debido a la presencia de una napa freática situada a poca profundidad, que hacía propicios dicho terrenos para el cultivo de frutales como el plátano maleño y la vid, como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida es por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo seco con frejoles.

Con mucho esfuerzo Consuelo logro tener su negocio de venta de abarrotes, helados y bebidas, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y porque tiene una muy buena ubicación.

Consuelo está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mercadería como útiles escolares (lapiceros, colores, folders, mochilas, entre otros), lo que le permitirá tener una mayor variedad de productos, así como también andamios y exhibidor para colocar sus productos, con esta mejora podra tener mayores ingresos, así seguirá luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 44 years old. She and her husband have 5 children and live in the city of Mala. Mala is an alluvial valley formed by the river of the same name. It rises to regular altitudes formed by Andean hills and foothills that occasionally reach the coast. It also has a prominent geograpical area called “Los Platanales,” made up of ancient, very humid and saltpetrous soil where abundant water surfaced from the subsoil due to the presence of a water table situated at a shallow depth, which made it advantageous for the cultivation of fruit such as Maleño bananas and grapevines  As a good Peruvian, Consuelo greatly enjoys food and one of her favorite dishes is the very delicious “seco con frijoles.”

With much effort, Consuelo succeeded in having her own business selling groceries, ice cream and drinks. She works around 12 hours and may wait on up to 15 customers a day. She believes her business is doing well because she is very friendly with her customers and because she has a good location.

Consuelo is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise such as school supplies (ballpoint pens, colors, folders and back packs among others), which will enable her to have a greater variety of products, as well as also scaffolding and a display case to hold her products. With this improvement she will be able to earn more income and thus will continue fighting to fulfill her great dream ”To provide a good education for her children.”

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the school season, scaffolding and a display case.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 55 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a freelancer, and is a mother to four children. Two are in elementary school while the other two are already working. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Eufemia dreams of growing her business in the coming years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ruth, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, ella y su esposo viven en casa de una de sus hijas. Su esposo ya no trabaja era agricultor.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y no depender de su hija se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días dos horas por las mañanas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra en dos o tres partes dependiendo del valor del producto, Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes, lleva más de 7 años en este negocio y le va bien, con esto ella tiene para sus gastos de sus medicinas entre otras cosas.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 13 años, es la tesorera del banco  y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su familia este bien.
texts.en:
The Rocafuerte Communal Bank meets every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte, a place renowned for the delicious and nationwide famous pastries prepared by the locals.

Here we meet Ruth, 66. She is married, she has four adult children and she and her husband live in the house of one of her daughters. Her husband was a farmer but he no longer works.

In order to earn something on her own to avoid depending on her daughter she sells clothes and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies). She works every day for two hours a day during the morning, and she sells door to door and by catalog order. She sells on credit and she collects cash in two or three dues, according to the value of the products. What she sells the most are cosmetics and perfumes; she has been engaged in this activity for more than 7 years and things are going very well; thanks to this activity she can pay for her medical expenses and other expenses.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes, perfumers, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams and other products. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for 13 years and she likes it because the loans have been a great help for her.

She wishes to remain in good health and that her family stays safe.

loans.use: To clothes, perfumers, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.

loans.name: Katherine Elizabeth

texts.es: Katherine es una mujer de 29 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa y zapatos su historia empezó desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de ropa y calzado, su trabajo lo hace solo todos los días, no tiene dificultades, está casada, si tiene2 hijas, su sueño más importante es tener un carro que le facilite recorrer con su mercadería y para sus hijas los estudios y lo que necesitan. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
Katherine is a 29-year-old woman who has many aspirations of prospering her business within the next few years. She sells clothing and shoes. Her story began when she was a young woman. She enjoys the retail business, so she decided to buy and sell clothing and shoes. Katherine works alone every day and does not face any difficulties. She is married and has two daughters.

Her greatest dreams are to have a car for transporting her merchandise and to provide for her daughters' education and the things they need. For this reason, her loan will be used to acquire clothing and shoes to sell.
